Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9993350134/job/27620500120)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9993350134/job/27620500952)

Sorry for missing the point of the trichotomy lemmas earlier. Here they are again with short proofs. You are welcome to add them back in.
```lean
lemma ball_subset_trichotomy :
    ball x r ⊆ ball y s ∨ ball y s ⊆ ball x r ∨ Disjoint (ball x r) (ball y s) := by
  wlog hrs : r ≤ s generalizing x y r s
  · rw [disjoint_comm, ← or_assoc, or_comm (b := _ ⊆ _), or_assoc]
    exact this y x s r (lt_of_not_le hrs).le
  · refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (ball x r) (ball y s) |>.symm.imp (fun h ↦ ?_) (Or.inr ·)
    obtain ⟨hxz, hyz⟩ := (Set.mem_inter_iff _ _ _).mp h.some_mem
    have hx := ball_subset_ball hrs (x := x)
    rwa [ball_eq_of_mem hyz |>.trans (ball_eq_of_mem <| hx hxz).symm]

lemma closedBall_subset_trichotomy :
    closedBall x r ⊆ closedBall y s ∨ closedBall y s ⊆ closedBall x r ∨
    Disjoint (closedBall x r) (closedBall y s) := by
  wlog hrs : r ≤ s generalizing x y r s
  · rw [disjoint_comm, ← or_assoc, or_comm (b := _ ⊆ _), or_assoc]
    exact this y x s r (lt_of_not_le hrs).le
  · refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (closedBall x r) (closedBall y s) |>.symm.imp
      (fun h ↦ ?_) (Or.inr ·)
    obtain ⟨hxz, hyz⟩ := (Set.mem_inter_iff _ _ _).mp h.some_mem
    have hx := closedBall_subset_closedBall hrs (x := x)
    rwa [closedBall_eq_of_mem hyz |>.trans (closedBall_eq_of_mem <| hx hxz).symm]
```
Thanks! I think there are some easy simplifications that can be made. I'll have another look when you think it's ready again.

Sorry for missing the point of the trichotomy lemmas earlier. Here they are again with short proofs. You are welcome to add them back in.
```lean
lemma ball_subset_trichotomy :
    ball x r ⊆ ball y s ∨ ball y s ⊆ ball x r ∨ Disjoint (ball x r) (ball y s) := by
  wlog hrs : r ≤ s generalizing x y r s
  · rw [disjoint_comm, ← or_assoc, or_comm (b := _ ⊆ _), or_assoc]
    exact this y x s r (lt_of_not_le hrs).le
  · refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (ball x r) (ball y s) |>.symm.imp (fun h ↦ ?_) (Or.inr ·)
    obtain ⟨hxz, hyz⟩ := (Set.mem_inter_iff _ _ _).mp h.some_mem
    have hx := ball_subset_ball hrs (x := x)
    rwa [ball_eq_of_mem hyz |>.trans (ball_eq_of_mem <| hx hxz).symm]

lemma closedBall_subset_trichotomy :
    closedBall x r ⊆ closedBall y s ∨ closedBall y s ⊆ closedBall x r ∨
    Disjoint (closedBall x r) (closedBall y s) := by
  wlog hrs : r ≤ s generalizing x y r s
  · rw [disjoint_comm, ← or_assoc, or_comm (b := _ ⊆ _), or_assoc]
    exact this y x s r (lt_of_not_le hrs).le
  · refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (closedBall x r) (closedBall y s) |>.symm.imp
      (fun h ↦ ?_) (Or.inr ·)
    obtain ⟨hxz, hyz⟩ := (Set.mem_inter_iff _ _ _).mp h.some_mem
    have hx := closedBall_subset_closedBall hrs (x := x)
    rwa [closedBall_eq_of_mem hyz |>.trans (closedBall_eq_of_mem <| hx hxz).symm]
```
I think this is precisely `isClosed_ball` in the file `Topology.MetricSpace.Pseudo.Lemmas`.
Changed import
Not really clear what you mean; can you expand a bit?

I looked at how nonarchimedean norms were specified elsewhere, and I saw it done using an explicit IsNonarchimedean hypothesis here: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/master/Mathlib%2FTopology%2FAlgebra%2FValued%2FNormedValued.lean#L32

There is also the option to work over Valued spaces instead of modifying the dist or the norm.
Added a comment
Have you tried to combine it with `NonarchAddGroupNorm`?
Not in this PR, but I have a follow-up branch where I will link this to the file where `IsNonarchimedean` is used. `NonarchAddGroupNorm` isn't used anywhere outside of the file where it is defined.

Since we're in the namespace, I think we can get away with:
```suggestion
lemma mem_ball_iff {x y: X} {r : ℝ} : y ∈ ball x r ↔ x ∈ ball y r := by
```
but this is optional.

idem
```suggestion
lemma mem_closedBall_iff {x y: X} {r : ℝ} :
```

I don't really see the point of this lemma, especially in light of `ball_eq_or_disjoint`, which can be proven directly much more simply (see below).
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  cases le_or_lt r 0 with
  | inl hr => rw [← Metric.ball_eq_empty (x := x)] at hr; simp [hr]
  | inr hr =>
      refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (ball x r) (ball y r) |>.symm.imp (fun h ↦ ?_) id
      have h₁ := ball_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_left h.some_mem
      have h₂ := ball_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_right h.some_mem
      exact h₁.trans h₂.symm
```

Will clean up. The reason for the trichotomy over the `ball_eq_or_disjoint` is that `ball_eq_or_disjoint` is at a fixed radius, while the trichotomy is over two independent radii. And as such, it subsumes into itself the argument one would have made using a `le_total` case analysis.
Oops, sorry, I missed the different radii

same issue
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  cases lt_or_le r 0 with
  | inl hr => rw [← Metric.closedBall_eq_empty (x := x)] at hr; simp [hr]
  | inr hr =>
      refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (closedBall x r) (closedBall y r) |>.symm.imp
        (fun h ↦ ?_) id
      have h₁ := closedBall_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_left h.some_mem
      have h₂ := closedBall_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_right h.some_mem
      exact h₁.trans h₂.symm
```

I realized the cases weren't necessary
```suggestion
  refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (ball x r) (ball y r) |>.symm.imp (fun h ↦ ?_) id
  have h₁ := ball_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_left h.some_mem
  have h₂ := ball_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_right h.some_mem
  exact h₁.trans h₂.symm	
```

```suggestion
  refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (closedBall x r) (closedBall y r) |>.symm.imp
    (fun h ↦ ?_) id
  have h₁ := closedBall_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_left h.some_mem
  have h₂ := closedBall_eq_of_mem <| Set.inter_subset_right h.some_mem
  exact h₁.trans h₂.symm
```

nodes.body: Thanks! I think there are some easy simplifications that can be made. I'll have another look when you think it's ready again.

Sorry for missing the point of the trichotomy lemmas earlier. Here they are again with short proofs. You are welcome to add them back in.
```lean
lemma ball_subset_trichotomy :
    ball x r ⊆ ball y s ∨ ball y s ⊆ ball x r ∨ Disjoint (ball x r) (ball y s) := by
  wlog hrs : r ≤ s generalizing x y r s
  · rw [disjoint_comm, ← or_assoc, or_comm (b := _ ⊆ _), or_assoc]
    exact this y x s r (lt_of_not_le hrs).le
  · refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (ball x r) (ball y s) |>.symm.imp (fun h ↦ ?_) (Or.inr ·)
    obtain ⟨hxz, hyz⟩ := (Set.mem_inter_iff _ _ _).mp h.some_mem
    have hx := ball_subset_ball hrs (x := x)
    rwa [ball_eq_of_mem hyz |>.trans (ball_eq_of_mem <| hx hxz).symm]

lemma closedBall_subset_trichotomy :
    closedBall x r ⊆ closedBall y s ∨ closedBall y s ⊆ closedBall x r ∨
    Disjoint (closedBall x r) (closedBall y s) := by
  wlog hrs : r ≤ s generalizing x y r s
  · rw [disjoint_comm, ← or_assoc, or_comm (b := _ ⊆ _), or_assoc]
    exact this y x s r (lt_of_not_le hrs).le
  · refine Set.disjoint_or_nonempty_inter (closedBall x r) (closedBall y s) |>.symm.imp
      (fun h ↦ ?_) (Or.inr ·)
    obtain ⟨hxz, hyz⟩ := (Set.mem_inter_iff _ _ _).mp h.some_mem
    have hx := closedBall_subset_closedBall hrs (x := x)
    rwa [closedBall_eq_of_mem hyz |>.trans (closedBall_eq_of_mem <| hx hxz).symm]
```
